channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SWARM-536] docker container - WFLYCTL0079: Failed initializing module org.jboss.as.logging
item.description:
This error is raised when a Swarm project is launched as docker container

Demo project is available here : https://github.com/cmoulliard/swarm-camel-demo/tree/master

mvn docker:build docker:run -Pdocker
 
mvn docker:logs -Pdocker
 
 
 
[INFO] --- docker-maven-plugin:0.15.7:logs (default-cli) @ demo ---
 
71cb33> I> No access restrictor found at classpath:/jolokia-access.xml, access to all MBeans is allowed

The project works perfectly when started locally

mvn wildfly-swarm:run

item.summary: docker container - WFLYCTL0079: Failed initializing module org.jboss.as.logging

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Are you by chance installing jolokia as a JVM agent within the docker container? Jolokia's agent uses JUL, and if JUL is used before WildFly's subsystem boots, then it can't install its own LogManager.

Same solution as WildFly, which is somewhat ugly, involving bootclasspath, if this is what you're seeing.
This is a duplicate of SWARM-204 . Using a different docker image then the fabric8 default one (which automatically installs the jolokia agent) works fine.
